For a finite sequence $A = (a_1, a_2,\ldots,a_n)$ of numbers, the \textit{Cesaro sum} of $A$ is defined to be \[\frac{S_1 + S_2 + \cdots + S_n}{n}\] where $S_k = a_1 + a_2 + \cdots + a_k\ \ \ \ (1 \le k \le n)$.  If the Cesaro sum of the 99-term sequence $(a_1, a_2, \ldots, a_{99})$ is $1000$, what is the Cesaro sum of the 100-term sequence $(1,a_1,a_2,\ldots,a_{99})$?\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 991\qquad\textbf{(B)}\ 999\qquad\textbf{(C)}\ 1000\qquad\textbf{(D)}\ 1001\qquad\textbf{(E)}\ 1009 $
